clinical_study.brief_title: EGFR Mutations on ctDNA in Patients With Advanced NSCLC
clinical_study.official_title: A Diagnostic Study to Determine the Prevalence of Epidermal Growth Factor Receptor Mutations Assessed With Circulating Tumor DNA Samples in Advanced Non-small Cell Lung Cancer

brief_summary.textblock: The study aims to explore the prevalence of EGFR mutations assessed with ctDNA samples in advanced NSCLC, who had received ≤ 1 prior systemic chemotherapy regimens.

primary_outcome.measure: Proportion of patients with EGFR mutation detected by amplification refractory mutation system (ARMS) assay
primary_outcome.description: The investigators will describe the proportion of EGFR mutation on ctDNA detected by ARMS assay in patients with non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC)

secondary_outcome.measure: Distribution of EGFR mutation by ARMS assays among the different Clinical characteristics
secondary_outcome.description: The investigators will employ chi-square test to analyze the distribution of EGFR mutation by ARMS in NSCLC patients among the different characteristics including smoking status, gender, age, PS score, and tumor stage

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of treatment-naive patients with EGFR mutation detected by amplification refractory mutation system (ARMS) assay
secondary_outcome.description: The investigators will describe the proportion of EGFR mutation on ctDNA detected by ARMS assay in treatment-naive patients with non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC)

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of patients after first-line chemotherapy failure with EGFR mutation detected by amplification refractory mutation system (ARMS) assay
secondary_outcome.description: The investigators will describe the proportion of EGFR mutation on ctDNA detected by ARMS assay in non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC) patients after first-line chemotherapy failure

clinical_study.condition: Non-small Cell Lung Cancer Stage III

study_pop.textblock: Patients with Non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC)
